text: "I got an antibody test recently and it came back negative. Does that mean I don’t have the neutralizing antibodies?" https://t.co/dcKnc8AVHy

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Through the entire American story, white Christianity has served as the central source of moral legitimacy for a society explicitly built to value the lives of white people over Black people," @robertpjones writes: https://t.co/l3o8h9Qa9C

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Apparently powerless to stop the chaos, Trump has now decided to embrace it, hoping that if he was unable to deliver the security he promised, perhaps heightened fear would motivate voters nearly as well," writes @GrahamDavidA: https://t.co/Rentqcw82c

name: TheAtlantic
text: With its latest “Tenet” announcement, Warner Bros. finally acknowledged reality: The U.S. is not ready for big films to return, and the country has lost its position as the most important movie market in the world, @davidlsims writes. https://t.co/jQpLb9CPVf

name: TheAtlantic
text: The risk of catching COVID-19 is much lower outdoors. So why aren't more schools considering holding classes outside? @olgakhazan reports: https://t.co/Li2ROaf31n

name: TheAtlantic
text: With its latest “Tenet” announcement, Warner Bros. finally acknowledged reality: The U.S. is not ready for big films to return, and the country has lost its position as the most important movie market in the world, @davidlsims writes. https://t.co/VYn3xaQEiV

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Even as bodies break down and memories start to fade," writes @JamesHamblin, "as long as people have the cognitive capacity to make decisions for themselves, our job as caregivers is to enable fulfillment of those wishes." https://t.co/u6RfhjBdjQ

name: TheAtlantic
text: Taylor Swift's outward-looking approach on “Folklore” has made her a better writer, and it might just create better listeners, @skornhaber writes: https://t.co/sM8dEueQbm

text: "Even if Congress somehow decreed the breakup of all four tech giants, the U.S. would still have an astounding number of industries controlled by a tiny number of firms," @ddayen writes: https://t.co/EPcZjBuMo8

text: Donald Trump promised religious voters that he would protect them with his Supreme Court appointments. The justices are not necessarily playing along. @emmaogreen reports: https://t.co/GsSjJhIo5D

name: TheAtlantic
text: The Flitcraft parable is a warning to white people: If you're not careful, you will find peace again. You will find comfort in a world designed with you in mind. The novelist Richard Russo writes about a parable for this historical moment: https://t.co/KBpftbdEZK

name: TheAtlantic
text: Two writers reflect on the country’s complicated relationship with super businesses—as well as its willingness to tolerate them. The latest Atlantic Daily, by @mimbsy: https://t.co/w6ZiFA4yPL

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @FranklinFoer: My dispatch from yesterday’s hearings: they made the break up of big tech more plausible.  https://t.co/LRfcpttiLJ

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: "At certain moments these days, he removes his mask from his pocket and waves it around like a little flag at an Independence Day parade—not as good as actually wearing it, but … progress." -- Andrew Ferguson on Trump:
https://t.co/WyFah2NO3r

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: “Nothing appears to change, only to persist, even as spectacles like this one demand intervention.” https://t.co/z8oEeVDBRN

name: TheAtlantic
text: Lasting happiness comes from deeply ordinary things, like time spent with loved ones—not from achievement or acclaim. But the "success addict" would rather be special than happy, @arthurbrooks writes in this week's How to Build a Life: https://t.co/QrQ6loRL0O

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @edyong209: This is an essential, terrifying, and deeply reported piece from @andersen on how China is using AI for totalitarian surveillance and exporting that tech to other regimes. 

https://t.co/8K04MtnQe4

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @andersen: 1/12 This is a thread about my new feature from our September issue.

It's called 'When China Sees All.' 

Last year, when such things were still possible, I visited one of China's national labs for artificial intelligence.

https://t.co/oUyOcQRglh https://t.co/ELkQHOMKIF

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: President Trump just explicitly suggested delaying the November election. A good time to read this one: https://t.co/oQSy7rBWEO

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @julieebeck: Lasting happiness comes from deeply ordinary things, @arthurbrooks writes — but “success addicts” turn away from those things in the pursuit of more and more achievement, and are never fully satisfied
